name: Balanced Foundation Plan
goal: Steady weight maintenance and sustained daily energy.
description: A nutrient-dense plan that keeps calories moderate while balancing complex carbohydrates, lean proteins, and healthy fats for reliable energy and appetite control.
focus: Lean protein at breakfast and lunch

mealGuidance.name: Breakfast
mealGuidance.description: Greek yogurt parfait with berries, chia seeds, and a sprinkle of oats.

mealGuidance.name: Lunch
mealGuidance.description: Grilled chicken grain bowl with quinoa, roasted vegetables, and olive oil vinaigrette.

mealGuidance.name: Snack
mealGuidance.description: Apple slices with almond butter or a small smoothie with greens.

mealGuidance.name: Dinner
mealGuidance.description: Salmon, roasted sweet potato, and steamed broccoli with lemon.

tips: Batch cook grains and proteins on Sundays to simplify lunches.
Aim for at least one leafy green and one brightly colored vegetable daily.
Keep mixed nuts or roasted chickpeas on hand for a quick snack.

name: Lean Strength Plan
goal: Support lean muscle building with controlled calories.
description: Higher protein distribution throughout the day preserves muscle mass while keeping carbohydrates targeted around training sessions.
focus: Protein at every meal and snack

mealGuidance.name: Breakfast
mealGuidance.description: Egg scramble with spinach, peppers, and turkey sausage plus whole-grain toast.

mealGuidance.name: Lunch
mealGuidance.description: Turkey and hummus wrap with mixed greens and a side of lentil soup.

mealGuidance.name: Snack
mealGuidance.description: Cottage cheese with pineapple or a protein shake with banana.

mealGuidance.name: Dinner
mealGuidance.description: Sirloin steak, roasted Brussels sprouts, and garlic mashed cauliflower.

tips: Prep a high-protein snack after workouts to support recovery.
Double vegetable portions at dinner for extra fiber and fullness.
Season meals generously with herbs to reduce the need for added salt.

name: Plant-Powered Vitality
goal: Maximize micronutrients with a plant-forward focus.
description: A mostly plant-based approach emphasizing legumes, seeds, and colorful produce while maintaining adequate protein for recovery.
focus: Two cups of leafy greens daily
Fermented foods several times per week

mealGuidance.name: Breakfast
mealGuidance.description: Overnight oats with soy milk, chia seeds, pumpkin seeds, and berries.

mealGuidance.name: Lunch
mealGuidance.description: Lentil and farro salad with roasted vegetables, arugula, and tahini dressing.

mealGuidance.name: Snack
mealGuidance.description: Carrots and cucumber with edamame hummus or roasted chickpeas.

mealGuidance.name: Dinner
mealGuidance.description: Tofu stir-fry with broccoli, snap peas, shiitake mushrooms, and brown rice.

tips: Rotate plant proteins to cover the full amino acid spectrum.
Blend frozen cauliflower or zucchini into smoothies for extra vegetables.
Add flax or chia to oatmeal for an omega-3 boost.

name: Metabolic Reset Low-Carb
goal: Improve insulin sensitivity with lower carbohydrate load.
description: Focused on non-starchy vegetables, quality fats, and steady protein portions to stabilize blood sugar while maintaining satiety.
focus: Non-starchy vegetables at lunch and dinner
Healthy fats like avocado, olives, and nuts
Evenly spaced meals to prevent grazing

mealGuidance.name: Breakfast
mealGuidance.description: Veggie omelet with feta and avocado slices.

mealGuidance.name: Lunch
mealGuidance.description: Baked chicken thighs over mixed greens with olives and cucumber.

mealGuidance.name: Snack
mealGuidance.description: Celery with hummus or a handful of walnuts.

mealGuidance.name: Dinner
mealGuidance.description: Zucchini noodles with turkey meatballs and roasted peppers.

tips: Start meals with a fiber-rich salad to support fullness.
Limit sweetened beverages; infuse water with citrus or herbs instead.
Prioritize sleep hygiene to reinforce metabolic recovery.

name: Mediterranean Refresh
description: Inspired by coastal Mediterranean eating with olive oil, seafood, legumes, and abundant produce for metabolic health and longevity.
focus: Extra-virgin olive oil as the primary cooking fat
Fish or legumes at least five times per week
Fresh herbs, citrus, and vinegar for flavor

mealGuidance.name: Breakfast
mealGuidance.description: Whole-grain toast with ricotta, tomato, basil, and olive oil drizzle.

mealGuidance.name: Lunch
mealGuidance.description: Farro and chickpea salad with cucumber, tomato, olives, and feta.

mealGuidance.name: Snack
mealGuidance.description: Greek yogurt with walnuts and honey or fresh fruit.

mealGuidance.name: Dinner
mealGuidance.description: Grilled cod with lemon, roasted eggplant, and herbed couscous.

tips: Keep a jar of marinated beans for quick protein add-ins.
Use herbs and citrus to brighten meals without extra salt.
Make a large salad base twice per week to assemble fast lunches.
